isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11899386</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/life/gardening/coquitlam+neighbours+build+giant+waterfall+shared+gardens/11899386/story.html</link><title>Who needs good neighbour fences when you have a joint waterfall?</title><description>Neighbours Jennifer Keyes and Teresa Richards say they now are now locked in to living next to one another forever because they have built a major waterfall feature between their two gardens. The neighbours have been working on their gardens together for the past 14 years and have succeeded in building two beautiful gardens.</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2016 00:56:09 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11899387.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Who needs good neighbour fences when you have a joint waterfall?" href="http://vancouversun.com/life/homes/gardening/bound-together-by-a-waterfall" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11898680</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/local-health/senior+women+more+likely+overprescribed+drugs+than/11898680/story.html</link><title>Elderly women more likely overprescribed drugs than men: UBC study</title><description>A new study suggests more elderly women than men of the same age in B.C. may be be taking medication they don&#8217;t need.&#160; University of B.C. researchers say nearly one in three B.C. women over age 65 received inappropriate prescription medicines in 2013, compared to one in four men, who received similar prescriptions. The study, [&#8230;]</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Thu, 05 May 2016 22:54:23 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11898686.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Elderly women more likely overprescribed drugs than men: UBC study" href="http://vancouversun.com/health/seniors/elderly-women-more-likely-overprescribed-drugs-than-men-ubc-study" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11898548</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/obesity+could+contagious+condition+that+spreads+like+stomach/11898548/story.html</link><title>Obesity could be a contagious condition that spreads like a stomach bug, scientists suggest</title><description>Obesity could be a contagious condition which spreads in the same way as bugs such as C.diff, scientists have suggested</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Thu, 05 May 2016 17:55:28 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11898549.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Obesity could be a contagious condition that spreads like a stomach bug, scientists suggest" href="http://news.nationalpost.com/health/obesity-could-be-a-contagious-condition-that-spreads-like-a-stomach-bug-scientists-suggest" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11898469</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/life/food/will+mama+papa+mommy+daddy+experts+explain+babies+first+words/11898469/story.html</link><title>Will it be mama or papa, mommy or daddy? Experts explain babies’ first words</title><description>There's little debate that mama and dada are often among baby's first utterances. But they can't really be called words until there's intent, and that doesn't typically happen until after 12 months of age</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Thu, 05 May 2016 14:54:47 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11898470.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Will it be mama or papa, mommy or daddy? Experts explain babies’ first words" href="http://news.nationalpost.com/life/will-it-be-mama-or-papa-mommy-or-daddy-experts-explain-babies-first-words" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11896419</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/decorating/designer+advice+couples+blending+homes+into/11896419/story.html</link><title>Advice for couples blending 2 homes into 1</title><description>For couples setting up a new home together, it's a challenge: how to merge two sets of stuff and two decorating styles into one space they both can love.</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Wed, 04 May 2016 19:36:05 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11895966.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11893949</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/news/local+news/kelowna+needs+help+send+donated+goods+cuba+after/11893949/story.html</link><title>Kelowna man needs help to send donated goods to Cuba after suffering stroke</title><description>For the last eight years, Rick Pogue has been on a solo mission to help Cubans in need. But sidelined after a stroke, the Kelowna man is turning to the community for help to continue his selfless work.&#160; In 2007 Pogue, like many Canadians, went to Varadero on an all-inclusive vacation. He returned to B.C. [&#8230;]</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Wed, 04 May 2016 18:41:48 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11893950.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Kelowna man needs help to send donated goods to Cuba after suffering stroke" href="http://vancouversun.com/news/local-news/kelowna-man-needs-help-to-send-donated-goods-to-cuba-after-suffering-stroke" /></item><item><guid only clinic providing sex reassignment surgeries suffers $700,000 in damages in arson attempt</title><description>The Montreal surgical clinic, Centre m&#233;tropolitain de chirurgie, is the only place in Canada that provides the surgery, but police are not yet saying if that's what motivated the crime</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Wed, 04 May 2016 13:53:09 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11868918.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Canada’s only clinic providing sex reassignment surgeries suffers $700,000 in damages in arson attempt" href="http://news.nationalpost.com/news/canada/arsonist-attempted-to-set-fire-to-canadas-only-clinic-providing-sex-reassignment-surgeries" /></item><item><guid landscapers switching to sod that tells chafer beetles to keep off the grass</title><description>Grass that tells chafer beetles to keep out
Tests show that using tall fescue grass is more resistant to European chafer beetle. Countless lawns in Metro Vancouver have been destroyed by crows, raccoons and skunks digging for chafer grubs. A mic of tall fescue and micro clover is also being touted as a good solution to the chafer problem as the mix also produces a sturdy, impenetrable lawn.</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Mon, 02 May 2016 23:07:37 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11883611.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="B.C. landscapers switching to sod that tells chafer beetles to keep off the grass" href="http://vancouversun.com/life/homes/gardening/in-the-garden-sod-that-tells-chafer-beetles-to-keep-off-the-grass" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11883567</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/health/night+shift+killed+memory+mood+hair/11883567/story.html</link><title>The night shift killed my memory, mood, and hair</title><description>The graveyard shift at a newspaper is many marvelous things - exciting, liberating, challenging, full of bizarre stories and excellent camaraderie - but healthful is not one of them</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Apr 2016 21:52:46 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11883570.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="The night shift killed my memory, mood, and hair" href="http://news.nationalpost.com/health/the-night-shift-killed-my-memory-mood-and-hair" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11883236</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/snapchat+users+reportedly+watching+billion+videos+they+aren+slowing+down/11883236/story.html</link><title>Snapchat users are reportedly watching 10 billion videos a day and they aren’t slowing down</title><description>Snapchat, which last raised money at a US$16 billion valuation, has more than 100 million daily users who spend 25 to 30 minutes on the app each day</description><source>Life</source><pubDate>Thu, 28 Apr 2016 15:25:20 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11883237.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item></channel></rss>
